Jotunn entered the underground base with a fierce determination that
unsett=
led even the local Garison Commander. He had been prepared to
welcome his L=
ord, but he had not been prepared for the Lord's actual
rejection of the we=
lcome party. Jotunn was here on business. That was
as simple as it could ge=
t.

He got up on an elevator and descended further in the hidden fortress.
=
He had not planned to actually take the Parliament with Wave 1. That,
even =
with the best estimates, would have been wishful thinking, and he
had not s=
urvived for so long as he had on wishful thinking. Wave 2,
however, would s=
how his supremacy undeniably.

The elevator stopped in front of the largest=
 door ever seen. It was
conceived to withstand the worst Minions could pack=
. This was a place
of the utmost security and the greatest importance. He w=
aited for the
security lock to scan his energy signature and the door to op=
en with a
very low rumble and a constant shuddering. He stepped in...

...o=
nly to find the Airtankers going at each other with a card game.

- I say, =
Bombtube, that was quite a nice bluff there. Too bad I had
the better hand.=


- Don' make me laugh, Gunrain! I shoulda been mo careful: you can'
lie! T=
her' was somfin you were up to!

- Stop bickering, you two! You only got lu=
cky for now! Lock-on, girl!
Start shuffling better!

- Blaming me for your =
loss, Motherload? Yet we all know Skysword's the
biggest cheater here!

Jot=
unn took out a pistol and fired once. The shot rang out in the
hangar and t=
he bullet finally ended by shooting through the deck of
cards. The Airtanke=
rs immediately pulled out their weapons and aimed
at the door. Once they re=
alized who was there, they quickly put it all
away and stood at attention.
=

Jotunn: Well, is this how you get ready? I believe I told the
Commander to=
 have you ready to set out as soon as I got here. Has that
not been done?

=
Motherload: My Lord, with all due respect, we are posted in that
weakling's=
 base, but he has no power over us. He fears us and thus has
no basis on wh=
ich he can give us orders. We answer to you only.

Jotunn: And was it not m=
entioned to you I gave the order? Do not mock
me Motherload; you're smarter=
 than that. You know only I command you
and would dare issue your orders.

=
Skysword: And what would be your orders now, O Lord?

Jotunn: Stand by for =
two cycles. Review your weaponry. I have to
communicate with my fellow lord=
s, but should their answer be...
unsatisfactory, we head out.

A grin came =
across Skysword's faceplate.

Skysword: =AD"We", Lord?

Jotunn: Yes... Me t=
oo.

He left them there, had the door closed up, and went back to the
comma=
nd center near the frozen surface.
